Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ivan1123
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights. The staff were very friendly. The room we had (2nd floor) didn't have a balcony but it had a direct view to the old part of the Sant Pau hospital which is a UNESCO heritage site. The room and bathroom were fairly big and comfortable. Very clean also. Air-conditioning is available but we didn't need to use it in April. The only issue with this hotel is that walls seem to be made of cardboard - you can very easily hear when your neighbors are having a shower. The windows didn't quite succeed in isolating from the street noise also. The first night it felt quite noisy, but the next nights I didn't have any problem with the noise as we were so tired of walking around Barcelona that it was not a problem to fall asleep at all. The hotel does have a cafeteria next to the reception which also serves as a restaurant - we had dinner there twice. There is a daily menu which is not very versatile but it was very well prepared and a big plus is that the restaurant is open till midnight. We had a late arrival from the airport and we could still have a decent dinner at the hotel. Pricing is very good - 11 EUR per person for a three course meal. Hotel breakfast is also very good although the same every day - continental type... but with some nice additions as fruit salad which was very nice. Free WI-FI access is also available on request at the reception. Barcelona touristic maps are waiting for you in the room and also at the reception. Sant Pau subway station is a 5-minute walk away where you can easily go to the city center in no more than 20 minutes. A bus stop is available just opposite the hotel but we preferred to use the subway. Gaudi's Sagrada Familia is on a 15-minutes walking distance. Overall, the hotel was a very nice experience and the location is just great.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a fair enough location”
Reviews.Author: noddie7
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights. The room was fine and quite warm for the winter. Sometimes we can hear the sound from the street but it's fine. Breakfast was nice and the staffs are friendly. At first, I found it hard to find the hotel from the metro exit, so if you're not sure where you're going, you better take the taxi for the 1st time. But actually after the explanation from the staff, it's just 2 blocks away from the metro. There is also a supermarket & bakery near the hotel. Sagrada Familia is just within a few minutes walk :)

Reviews.Title: “There's better hotels around”
Reviews.Author: aaalanaaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amrey Sant Pau for two nights. Our room was on the ground floor and wheelchair-accessible. This meant that the shower did not have a rim, so the water flowed all over the bathroom. Also, there was a window right where the shower was. Since we were on the ground floor I could see cars and people passing by my window - I felt like they could see me showering too, so that didn't feel to comfortable. Also, the hotel isn't very close to the centre. Yes, there is a metro about a five-minute walk away, but I still wouldn't recommend this hotel for a short trip. We of course knew where the hotel was located when we booked it, but we felt like we lost too much time "commuting". A nice sight is the hospital Sant Pau right in front of the hotel - they were remodeling during our stay but it still looked nice. The room was nice and clean, though. The only thing bothering me a little (besides the shower), was that it was a little dark. There was only little illumination, but since we didn't spend much time in the hotel it was okay for us. The people at the reception were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July of 2011 for a conference at the nearby University St Pau. We were a little worried at first by the two star rating but the hotel was excellent for the price. I don't know if I have had better value anywhere else. Get a room with a balcony as the view is great and have breakfast included with your room. A great area where we felt safe, day or night and lots of small cafes to eat or have a drink. There are many shops and places to eat within walking distance and cabs are inexpensive in Barcelona (at least compared to Newfoundland). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eteo
Reviews.Content: Not the best location but it is situated close to the metro. About a 10 minute uphill walk. From there you can take a straight train to Paseig de Gracia. Not a lot around the hotel so it was quiet. The room was a little small but clean and basic. I found the reception staff to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but decent hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: sas123Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights on a recent hockey tour of the city . The hotel while basic is perfect for a large party on a trip to the city, the rooms although quite small are clean and the bed is comfortable . It's probably worth asking for one of the outer rooms, the room we had faced into an interier courtyard which made it quite dark, this really wasn't a problem though for the short time we stayed in the room . The bar area is pleasant enough for a drink, inside or out and the breakfasts were very good . The area surrounding the hotel is very pleasant and there are a good number of good bars and restaurants as you make the short trip over to the cathedral . The ramblas and the beach are on the underground line very close to the hotel . The tapas bar across the road is a great spot to introduce yourself to some Spanish food and drink when you arrive . All in all a perfect base to tour the city on a budget .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not too close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Travellingpants
Reviews.Content: Nice. modern hotel in Barcelona. Bit of oa walk to metro but close the Sant pau hospital. Staff were not the friendliest. Thye have an in house restaurant with reasonably priced food but the breakfast buffet was a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet hotel, good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MiaEllinitha-USA
Reviews.Content: The Amrey San Pau is situated in a good neighborhood, next door to the Hospital de Sant Pau - a UNESCO World Heritage Site - it is an amazingly beautiful hospital (you can take a tour if you want to). Also within walking distance is Gaudi's masterpiece, Sagrada Familia. There, you can purchase tickets for Barcelona's tour bus for one or two days. I recommend this, as Barcelona is a sprawling city and you get an outdoor flavor of the city with the tourbus. The Amrey is modern and clean. Front desk staff is courteous and friendly. The room we had was a fair size with a full bathtub. Our room faced the main road and had a nice size balcony with a lovely view. You may want to ask for extra pillows. Not many frills, but adequate. Wifi is free, but you have to get the access code from the front desk. We enjoyed the small outdoor cafe the hotel offers. You basically order at the bar and they bring the meal out to you or you can eat in the dining area. A very efficient and friendly waitress/cook named Michaela should be commended for her exemplarly work in the hotel's cafe. We did not partake in the hotel's breakfast, as they charged 9 Euros, which seemed rather steep. The dinner menu was affordable and the food was good. Coffee is good and fairly priced. All in all, you will not be disappointed with the Amrey Sant Pau, as it has all the basic amenities and is fairly priced in a good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “We were charged twice”
Reviews.Author: Praguevisit0r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and staff quite nice but what a surprise when we came back and realized the hotel charged us twice for the night we spend there! I made a reservation and had to give my credit card details as a guarantee. I was asured that the card will not be charged without my authorisation. At the hotel my husband paid for the accommodation with his card and the hotel still charged my card the same amount!! Unfortunately it was not the first time this happened in Spain so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Muffinfactory
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor. When we got to hotel, reception was very warm and friendly. We asked for a room facing the Hospital de Sant Pau and the receptionist reassured us that he had a good room for us. The room was on the top floor and from there up another flight of steps which initially got me slightly concerned. But we opened the room - it was good size, cozy, good double bed and the bathroom/toilet was immaculate. The best bit was - I thought it was just going to be a little window facing the beautiful Sant Pau hospital - but upon drawing the curtains, we stepped onto a wide balcony with chairs and table to lounge on whist taking in the amazing view. The reception later pointed us to a few tapas bars nearby as that was what we meant to go to Spain for. The tapas, as I had anticipated, were divine. I knew the Sagrada Familia was within walking distance from the hotel but in fact it was only about 10mins walk away. So I'd say a superb location in that respect. However it in the centre (La Rambla) where everything is but it's only a few metro stops away. Bought the T-10 ticket based on Tripadvisor advise as well which served us very well indeed. The only thing was that personally, we like thicker/bigger pillows as the ones in the room were slightly flat. Nonetheless we asked the reception for extra pillows which they graciously obliged us with. Also could do with slightly better directions to the hotel on the website (although it was relatively easy to find on Googlemaps). Finally, perhaps the hotel could consider room service? Also very impressive was that the room was cleaned everyday when we were away - they never disturbed us when we were in the room but once we got back from city sightseeing, it's like little elves had come to clean the room. Superb. Overall I have to say, the hotel was absolutely superb - all the basic things you need from a hotel. Good value for money (for Barca standards and close to town and on Easter weekend!) Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: vladomedin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location(10 min walk from Sagrada Familia).Service is really good only thing that is negative in this hotel are thin wall through you can heard everything.

Reviews.Title: “The motto of this hotel should be, "Customer go away; you annoy me; get out of my face /and hotel/".”
Reviews.Author: kc4asia
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel were exceedingly rude. Whenever we had a problem or concern, they were very defensive and did nothing. We wanted a double bed but they provided two twins even though a few hours later (during the dead of the night) a double miraculously appeared. They stated we hadn't asked for a double when it was clearly stated on our reservation receipt. One day the housekeeping had not been done by 3pm. Their response was "She has till 4pm. That's out policy; get used to it. And by the way, stay out of the room till it's made up". (This took an hour.) All I can say is that front desk staff in this hotel are nasty, nasty, nasty. My advice to anyone is "Don't put yourself through the humiliation of staying at this awful hotel". And all this for $115 per night. The old adage, "you get what you pay for" clearly does not apply here unless you consider you are paying for abuse.

Reviews.Title: “Superb 2* hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FabiolaLondon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a very satisfying stay in this hotel. The quality of their services were far beyond our expectations for a 2 star hotel. We definitely would go back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “we re pleased to stay there”
Reviews.Author: aydinci76
Reviews.Content: The hote workers are very helpfull, breakfast is very good, the view of the room is to amrey sant pau hospital, a marvelleuous building. We will come again. Aydin & Duygu

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthLondonNoMore
Reviews.Content: Bad things: No security deposit box in room Horrible room with no view, obscured glass on all windows, could have been a prison cell Bathroom looking slightly tatty, bathroom door deformed so wouldn't close properly Shower with shower curtain over bath - I hate these Room didn't smell particularly fresh Not a great location in terms of closeness to old town but it's safe No free wifi Better things: Breakfast is ok (not great) and well managed by the staff Safe location

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms which smelt of ciggarettes, ok location”
Reviews.Author: jleeLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a ok'ish location, 15 min walk to main attraction or 10 mins on the metro to beach and marina. Hotel had very small rooms, all of which smelt of ciggarettes and was masked over by air freshner and smelt just awful - all my clothes smelt because of it. Ok breakfast, staff reasonable - no room service but they have a bar / cafe on ground floor. If you are looking for Barca on a budget and don't intend to spend much time in the room, hotel would suit.

Reviews.Title: “Great as home base to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Shkup
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are clean, not very roomy but not dense either. The T.V was ok, Good air condition and there even was internet coverage at the room. They offered us 6 EU a person breakfast which was great. The area of the hotel is lovely and quiet. It is a walking distance from the "Sagrada Famillia" and of course the Sant Pau old hospital. Mention that if you turn right when you exit the hotel and go up the street you will reach to the new Sant Pau Metro station that makes your transportation a breeze. The staff were very nice to us. We were highly satisfied with the Hotel and had a great experience with it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: aLucky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days for business. Room was spacious and fine, although the window was shaded as it opens into inside yard. Internet is free. Breakfast is pretty good for 6 euros. Metro yellow and blue lines within walking distance. Food in cafeteria is pretty good and prices are reasonable. The only problem I found is that they don't give you iron into the room. You can only get it as a service, but no guarantee that clothes will be ironed by the next morning. It may be an issue for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMorning
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and we didnt face any problems. Staff at reception was nice and helpful. The parking is paid and there is no direct door to the hotel, so you have to get to street, but no big issue. As usually, the parking space is very limited, so you got to be an experience driver to be able to park your car at all :) The location is ok, it feels safe and clean, you have 5-10 min walk to the metro station. Just next to the hotel is huge Sant Pau Hospital - very interesting architecture and one of the places to see, but i believe, it can get noisy with sirens if your windows are facing hospital side. We had a room with window towards small space between buildings and that was also the major negative for me. No view, not much of fresh air. We paid for breakfast in the hotel and it was really a great value, just 5euros and solid food. But I am not sure, if it is a permanent price, or just a special offer. Definitely check it out, for 5 euros it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for getting to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BrendaMc82
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed here in October 2008 for 5 days..sorry for delayed review!! As two women on our own we felt v.safe in the area, much more so than down near las ramblas. We found this to be fantastic value for money when booked thru hotels.com compared with booking direct with the hotel. the room was absolutely spotlessly clean with a great bathroom which had plenty of hot water, yes a mini fridge would have been handy but then again there was spar shop opposite the hotel which was handy to run out to for drinks etc, there was a t.v in the room which was on mtv most of the time as it was the only station in English!! The hotel staff are great, very polite and helpful giving directions and the like and allowed me to print off boarding passes FOC. The only downside we had to this hotel was the bar (which was very cheap for a hotel bar, with great snacks) seemed to close very early at around 9pm! There aren’t many places to have dinner around the hotel but it is only a short walk to the cathedral where there are plenty of eateries, so in that respect it is a little isolated, in the morning there are lots of cafes near the hotel doing coffee and huge croissants for around 3€..fantastic! All in all a great place to stay and I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jeanitha
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for three nights in march. We were lucky to be able to book a super offer and only paid 147 euros totally for three nights which we found very cheap. There wasn't really something that we didn't like about the hotel. The staff was really friendly, the rooms were not very big but did well and were always very, very clean. I never found one little hair or spot. If you ask for a room on the fifth or sixth floor you can invite all your friends because the balcony is enormous and the view is spectacular at the hospital st pau. In the bathroom you don't have a lot of space for all your stuff but we didn't make a problem out of that. The shower has good pressure so that was really nice. You can also eat some lovely sandwiches in the cafeteria. We never made it to have breakfast so we can't say anything about that. The hotel is a bit far from the centre but the metro takes you to all turistic places in about 3 stops. We will definitately come back next time we visit Barcelona! Only one little point, the beds were a bit hard but we have to admit we both have expensive matrasses back home so we are kinda spoiled ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good enough for the money”
Reviews.Author: diy200701
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amrey during December visit to Barcelona. I agree with most other reviewers - this is a very basic hotel but it is good value for the money. The rooms are very simple with almost no amenities. The staff is very attentive. The hotel is located in a quite, safe residential neighborhood right next to a very big (and beautiful) hospital. It is 10 minute walk to Sangrada de Familia, biggest cathedral in Barcelona. This location is also a stop for most tour buses, so you can begin a city tour here if you would like to. There are 2 trains stations 5 minute walk from the hotel. I recommend using different stations depending if you are going to or from the hotel to avoid walking up-hill. Trains arrive every 5 minutes, and it is easy to get to most popular places in Barcelona with 15 minutes. There is free wireless internet available, but only in the lobby. What we liked - location, value What we did not like - wireless internet is not available in the rooms, only in the lobby Train station - going TO hotel: L4, Guinardo Train station - going FROM hotel: L5, Camp De L'arpa Google map: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona over New Years on a budget and the Amrey Sant Pau was a great value. It is located within walking distance to Gaudi's famous Sagrada Familia cathedral, but far from everything else. However, we did manage to master the metro and night buses because of the location and were no worse for the wear! The hotel is in a very residential neighborhood and thus very quiet and peaceful at night - good for escaping the craziness of Las Ramblas. We also felt pretty safe as the reception desk faces the entrance and is manned 24/7. The rooms are small, very basic, but clean, and provide a nice view at night. The beds are of average comfort, but warm. The closet and drawer space is limited There was a large pillar in the middle of the room that looked awkward and hindered access to the closet.and a bit musty, but we were not going to use them anyway. The bathroom was very clean, but again, sparse, with not a lot of space for our toiletries. There was both a bidet and toilet. The balcony is decent-sized and semi-private (there is a clouded glass divider), with a couple of metal chairs and a small table. A little too chilly for New Year's, but probably great when it's warm. The room rate is inclusive of breakfast, which was simple, but enough to tide us over until lunch. Overall, a great value for travelers of modest means.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: dealt-a-bad-hand
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in barcelona. I will keep this straight to the point: Location: Ok its not in the heart of las ramblas but its only 5 mins walk from 2 metro stations which gives you VERY easy access to the city. Location in my opinion was perfect, i wouldnt want to be on the ramblas as too noisy etc. The room: The room was as clean as any ive ever stayed in, ok it was basic but all rooms are air conditioned. shower was very good too. Staff: Very friendly and helpful This hotel is perfect for a short break, prehaps even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Modern, Clean and very helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ScottthedotLondon
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in the Amrey Sant Pau and can highly recommend it. The hotel is modern and very clean with quite basic rooms. Ours did not have tea-making facilities but it did have air-conditioning and a lovely view of the Hotel de Sant Pau next door. There was a fresh buffet breakfast each morning with plenty of variety. Most importantly, the staff were very helpful and friendly. They helped us with our Catalonian and with bus and train routes and timetables as well as advice on restaurants, clubs and bars. They all understood and spoke English which was very helpful. The hotel is not in the centre of the city however there is plenty going on outside the front door. There are bars, restaurants and shops nearby as well as the Sagrada Familia Cathedral only being a pleasant 10 minute walk away. There are very good bus routes from right outside that cover most of the city as well as the Metro being only a 5 minute walk away. I would definately recommend it to anyone intending to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Amrey”
Reviews.Author: Meerceea
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from a short 5 day trip to Barcelona, Spain. We booked the Amrey Sant Pau Hotel through an online booking website and we were not dissapointed. The hotel is fairly new and has a modern clean design. The room we stayed in was very clean and spacious and had an ensuite bathroom with an actual bathtub (not often found in hotels). We also had a TV with cable (various spanish and catalan stations plus a few international ones - cnn, bbc, tv5 etc). We had an included a buffet breakfast, with plenty food on offering. On the downside, the room we stayed in was a bit noisy as it faced the street and the hotel is situated next to the Sant Pau Hospital, Also, please don't try the pizza at the cafeteria, as this is the place in which we ate the most dreadfull pizza ever. Maybe the other items in the menu are better (pasta, sandwiches, etc) Overall we are very happy with this hotel and we will probably use it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most 3-stars”
Reviews.Author: BASWIMMER
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than most 3-star hotels and even some 4-star hotels at which I have stayed in Europe. The hotel is very clean and the room is comfortable. It is not a luxury hotel, but it meets the basic needs. The TV has CNN and BBC. I found no noise problem. It is a couple of blocks to a Metro station, and within walking distance to the Sagrada Familia. There are various restaurants in the area. The front desk people all wear business suits, and are professional and courteous. Barcelona is a great vacation destination. I plan to go back during the summer when it is warmer and more festive.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ibtzq
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days here last September. Rooms are spacious enough. Good location. However, very noisy. Hospital in the area and ambulances with sirens blasting day & night. Buffet breakfast was not bad, though don't expect to get eggs, bacon or sausages. Coffee dreadful. Staff: extremely nice and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Amrey Sant Pau
HotelInfo.Address: 173 Sant Antoni Maria Claret | Esquina Sant Quintí, 08041 Barcelona, Spain
